titles.title: Iran Sanctions Extension Act
Iran Sanctions Extension Act
Iran Sanctions Extension Act
Iran Sanctions Extension Act
To reauthorize the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996.
Iran Sanctions Extension Act

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on Financial Services, the Judiciary, Ways and Means, and Oversight and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on Financial Services, the Judiciary, Ways and Means, and Oversight and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on Financial Services, the Judiciary, Ways and Means, and Oversight and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on Financial Services, the Judiciary, Ways and Means, and Oversight and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on Financial Services, the Judiciary, Ways and Means, and Oversight and Government Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.
Mr. Royce moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6297.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 419 - 1 (Roll no. 577).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 693.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 99 - 0. Record Vote Number: 155.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Sent to Archivist of the United States unsigned.

term.name: International monetary system and foreign exchange

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the House passed version is repeated here.)
Iran Sanctions Extension Act
(Sec. 2) This bill extends the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996 through December 31, 2026.
